alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 11:29AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN INTO THE WEEKEND FOR GULF COAST AND ICY STRAIT CORRIDOR... An atmospheric river has been giving moderate to heavy rain to parts of the northern half of Southeast Alaska. Heavy rain started late Wednesday night near Yakutat, and is expected to slide over the Icy Strait corridor and central gulf coast late Friday. So far, the Yakutat airport has received well over 5 inches of rain from Wednesday night through Friday morning, and another 2 to 3 inches of rain is expected through Saturday. The heaviest rainfall is expected to last through Saturday morning before diminishing Saturday afternoon. The Situk River has been rising rapidly from the heavy rain, but is still well below bankfull conditions as of Friday morning. The Situk, and other rivers near Yakutat, are expected to remain within their banks, but will still be running higher then usual. The Northern Inner Channels, including the Icy Strait corridor, will see somewhat lesser amounts ranging from 2 to 5 inches of rainfall, with the highest amounts from Cross Sound to Juneau. This heavier rainfall is mainly expected from Friday evening through Saturday morning. There are some uncertainties in the total rainfall forecast as terrain could cause some local areas to get more or less total rainfall. Northern inner channel rivers and streams are expected to rise as a result of this rainfall. At this time, flood potential is low, but rivers may reach, or get near, bankfull conditions. People who recreate along rivers and streams across the northern panhandle should remain alert. For any updated information on this evolving event visit weather.gov/juneau.
